comments:
Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Open Test Navigator.
2. Go to logical view.
3. Save any workspace resource.
4. Use the sleak SWT tool to see images leaked from Test Navigator code.


More information:
TestNavigatorLabelProvider.getImage() always creates a new image for IContainer resources.  Apparently this method gets called at least once every time there's a resource change in the workspace, regardless of whether that resource is shown in the Test Navigator.  Eventually this will hit the operating systems limit for GDI handles and since the SWTError is unhandled, it will cause the workbench to core.

This problem was found in TPTP 4.2.2 and looking at the code appears to have been fixed in version 1.3 of TestNavigatorLabelProvider.java which went into the 4.4 branch.

Here is the related stack trace:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 2007-08-21 03:15:33.453
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2007-08-21 03:15:33.453
!MESSAGE No more handles
!STACK 0
